This is fascinating! The Braille Institute has developed a font - free to download - that's designed to be clearer for readers with lower vision.

An example of one of the aspects of low legibility that they tackled attached.

It's named Atkinson Hyperlegible. Atkinson was the Institute's founder - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Robert_Atkinson

Here's where you can read about the font and download it: https://brailleinstitute.org/freefont

#Accessibility

Via @tombofnull

title: Robert Tinney's Visions Of The Future - Doc Pop's Blog

last_post.content:
Robert Tinney was the cover artist for Byte magazine from 1975-1986, where he cranked out these fantastic paintings that captured the spirit of tech from that time. Here is one of my favorites (from 1981). #RetroComputing #Byte

I've shared more of Robert's retro-futuristic paintings on my blog https://docpop.org/2020/11/robert-tinneys-visions-of-the-future/

Robert is also selling prints via his site http://tinney.net/

Starting 2023, four universities are pausing or ending their Elsevier subscription due to exorbitant pricing.

Elsevier's subscription was costing them ~10% of their Libraries' entire budget.

"Elsevier’s prices have increased each year and have outpaced inflation"...this is despite Elsevier having the highest profit margins of virtually any other industry or publisher.

via https://www.dailyemerald.com/news/pressing-pause-on-elsevier-subscription/article_93c07dec-9120-11ed-8ce9-abbca97ab954.html

title: Musk’s Twitter Intentionally Suspended Tweetbot, Third-Party Apps, Messages Show

last_post.content:
"The mysterious outage of Tweetbot and other third-party Twitter clients that began Thursday night was an intentional suspension, according to internal messages viewed by The Information. The suspension cut off the ability of people to use Twitter on outside apps, forcing them to go to Twitter’s own app."

https://www.theinformation.com/articles/musks-twitter-intentionally-suspended-tweet-bot-third-party-apps-messages-show

This website provides the full back archive of BYTE magazine, all 23 years of it from 1975 to to 1998. It's a treasure trove of vintage tech and nostalgia, not even Archive.org carries all the issues.

The site actually focuses on old Apple magazines, but has also PC magazines and other resources on the history of microcomputing.

https://vintageapple.org/byte

#retrocomputing #magazines

title: Brave Adds Support for Bridges in Private Windows with Tor | Brave Browser

last_post.content: Plus, you can now easily run a @torproject Snowflake inside of your @brave client, which allows you to be a proxy for the Tor network! Snowflake proxies are intended to be ephemeral so they are hard for censors to find but easy for Tor to deliver to people who need a way round censorship. Snowflake bridges have seen massive use in Iran over the last couple of months as the government increasingly restricts internet freedom. https://brave.com/tor-bridges/

title: Will Europe’s Privacy Bill of Rights Ever Truly Be Enforced? – The Markup

last_post.content:
Europe’s landmark privacy law looks good on paper, but enforcement has been spotty. That’s why activist Tanya O’Carroll is taking Meta to court in the U.K. to assert her right to object to personalized advertising under Europe’s #GDPR.

“If the European gold standard data protection legislation doesn’t apply to data profiling and ad targeting by one of the biggest tech companies on Earth, then what does it apply to?” O’Carroll asks in today’s newsletter from @Julia.

https://themarkup.org/hello-world/2023/01/14/will-europes-privacy-bill-of-rights-ever-truly-be-enforced

My first meta-scientific project is out! 🙌🏻

We assessed #OpenScience and #Reproducibility practices across #Linguistics and how they changed over time. What did we find? Low rates overall with no #Preregistrations, some #DataSharing and very little analysis/code sharing. Small but some increase ⬆️ between over a decade ago and more recently.

Check out more juicy details in the #Preprint https://osf.io/preprints/metaarxiv/rcews/ and this helpful 🐦 thread by @TimoRoettger: https://twitter.com/timoroettger/status/1613221295302316042?s=46&t=CJTmfUQw5lt6Gm0CdVhcgQ
My book is here 🤩 Still can't believe it exists. https://amzn.to/3VNIqzs

title: Germany, EU remain heavily dependent on imported fossil fuels

last_post.content:
1.5 years ago Germany imported more than 60% of the gas it consumed from Russia.

Since late August 2022 it is 0%.

The scale of this change is incredible and would have been thought of as impossible in the past.

https://www.cleanenergywire.org/factsheets/germanys-dependence-imported-fossil-fuels

Let's just step back and take stock of how phenomenal it is that @medium has created the me.dm instance, for their users on Mastodon (https://blog.medium.com/medium-embraces-mastodon-19dcb873eb11).

Medium is a commercial online publishing platform. Rather than see Mastodon as competition, Medium is offering their users me.dm, a Mastodon instance, as a benefit. Something which will make Medium more attractive.

Mastodon is a now a Medium feature.

This is new and revolutionary.

Our Annual Review piece "Replicability, Robustness, and Reproducibility in Psychological Science" was the 4th most downloaded article across Annual Review journals in 2022 (https://www.annualreviews.org/page/top-2022).

Because of that, they have made the formatted version openly accessible for a limited time (https://www.annualreviews.org/doi/10.1146/annurev-psych-020821-114157).

And, the Green OA version is always open: https://psyarxiv.com/ksfvq/

Assessing ExxonMobil’s global warming projections https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.abk0063

For decades, some members of the fossil fuel industry tried to convince the public that a causative link between fossil fuel use and climate warming could not be made because the models used to project warming were too uncertain. Supran et al. show that one of those fossil fuel companies, ExxonMobil, had their own internal models that projected warming trajectories consistent with those forecast by the independent models

I'm sharing this as an actual solution to empower civilians.

Please check out TurnSignl, an app founded by Black civil rights lawyers. It lets you video call a lawyer asap through voice activation or single touch when police pull you over. The lawyer manages & records the entire convo w/police & works to get you home safe.

It's like $7/mo and free for low income people. It's in a few dozen states & will be nationwide shortly. I have it myself.

See it here:

https://m.turnsignl.com/get_app/NbAW

title: Prevent unwanted Layout Shifts caused by Scrollbars with the scrollbar-gutter CSS property

last_post.content:
TIL you can prevent layout shift when changing from

overflow: hidden;

to

overflow: auto; /* or scroll */

by adding

scrollbar-gutter: stable;

to the container 🤯

No more hacky padding-and-JavaScript shenanigans! Thanks @bramus for sharing!

title: Looking for new projects or even a long-term something for 2023

last_post.content:
I'm looking for new projects and potentially even something long-term for 2023

Background/interests/etc all in this new blog post. Please do share with friends if you read something that would resonate with them. Thanks!

https://interconnected.org/home/2023/01/12/next

PyTorch is the most popular deep learning framework in research and is rapidly gaining adoption in industry.

Its core API is straightforward and can be learned in just two steps:
(1) defining the model and
(2) setting up the training loop.

I have a 3-minute video here to get you started -- it is definitely possible to get started over the weekend: https://lightning.ai/pages/courses/deep-learning-fundamentals/3-0-overview-model-training-in-pytorch/3-5-the-pytorch-api-parts-1-2/

https://vogin-ip-lezing.net/2023/01/12/wetenschappelijke-netwerken-visualiseren-met-vosviewer/
Wetenschap is bij uitstek een terrein van verbanden en relaties. Relaties tussen auteurs, verbanden tussen onderwerpen, links tussen publicaties, connecties tussen instituten en relaties tussen al dit soort entiteiten onderling.
Deze verbanden en netwerken kun je automatisch analyseren en visualiseren met VOSviewer. De ontwikkelaar van dit gratis softwarepakket geeft 16 maart een workshop bij de #voginip-lezing

https://datasette.io/plugins/datasette-faiss is a Datasette wrapper around Facebook Research's FAISS fast vector index - it dropped the time needed to brute-force compare 3,000 similarity vectors from 1.3s to 5ms

https://datasette.io/plugins/datasette-cookies-for-magic-parameters is a bit of an odd one: it lets you store parameters (such as API keys) in browser cookies rather than passing them in ?query-strings - to help avoid secrets being accidentally recorded in referrer or access logs

title: Catastrophe #88: The Texas Legislature Returns for a Brutal Year

last_post.content:
Other bills attempt to capitalize on the moral panic around #drag queens, simultaneously using it as a way to attack both #LGBTQIA culture as a whole and the ability of #transgender people to participate in public life. HB 643 from Representative Jared Patterson broadly seeks to ban anyone from “performing” in public when #children are present if the performer’s clothing doesn’t match conservative norms for their assigned #gender at birth. It’s so broadly written, in fact, that experts are concerned it could even ban #trans people from performing at major league sporting events or all-ages concerts. Venues found to be in violation would face misdemeanor charges. 

“That could literally mean a trans person doing standup at a comedy show would then turn it into a sexually oriented business,” @esqueer said.

From “Catastrophe 88” at @TexasObserver https://www.texasobserver.org/texas-legislature-preview-2023/

#txlege #Texas #news #politics #Fascism

title: Development of an Offline-Friend Addiction Questionnaire (O-FAQ): Are most people really social addicts? - Behavior Research Methods

last_post.content:
A fantastic way to make an important point. Researchers took items from widely-used scales of "social media addiction," and reworded them to be about spending time offline with friends. Using parallel criteria, they discovered that 69% of people are addicted to spending time with friends.

"Readers should approach our measure with a level of skepticism that should be afforded to current social media addiction measures."

(h/t @cconrymurray)

https://link.springer.com/article/10.3758/s13428-020-01462-9

My winter break project was an app to browse and follow academics from many of the lists on the Academics on Mastodon page.

https://find.sciences.social reads data from the lists, and makes it easy to see profiles and follow academics.

The app doesn't scrape or store any information - it just shows the cdv-files in a new and (I hope) more useful way.

Give it a try.
